オプション1: "Hold up a second. It's a Cube again." Star Man said to the kids.

Because they were carrying a stretcher, there were times they couldn't detour around monsters.
They set the stretcher down on the ground.

The Cube stood motionless.
With no face, it was hard to tell if it had noticed them.

Star Man raised a hand above the Cube.
A massive block of ice appeared over it and fell.
The Cube half‑collapsed; the ice turned to mist and vanished.

The Cube remained still.
After a short rest, Star Man used the same attack again.
The Cube broke apart.
"Bravo!"
"Bravo!"
When Trapezoid Man said that and clapped, Triangle Man copied him.

Star Man walked forward, ready to deal with enemies as needed.
The children carried Trapezoid Man on the stretcher and followed behind.

Star Man's burns still hadn't healed.
Every time he moved, the wounds reopened and yellow fluid oozed out.
The pain made him break into a sweat that wouldn't dry.

He could use ice only when the enemy wasn't moving.
(It might be useful against VSCO—the attacking white ones.)

Still, his fire and dark magic were weak.
(It'd be tough to fight a VSCO with them...)
Morning came at last.
Trapezoid Man patted Star Man on the back.
"Take a break. I'll keep watch."
"...Yeah."

Exhausted, they decided to rest.
Trapezoid Man kept watch while the other three slept.
At noon the next day, the three woke up.

No one spoke from lack of sleep and fatigue.
They shared the acorns they'd taken when they fled at night,
and the four set out.
